page.title: 04Farms near St.Germans
page.content:
Small-scale farming is largely gone from the area, as only large farms are now economically viable. The farms which cover the area utilise a great deal of expensive machinery but fewer full-time workers than was previously the case. This means that many local families have had to look elsewhere for employment.
A great variety of crops is grown in this very flat area which is esentially re-claimed river-delta/sea marsh, and so is extremely fertile. All the farms are arable, though there are a very few animals kept, including goats, chickens and turkeys.
A few villagers, and some recent arrivals, have set up small-holdings comprising a few hectares and buildings, to supplement a main job.
